maml:description.maml:para: Gets a resource from the FIM/MIM service
This cmdlet allows you retrieve a single object from the FIM/MIM service using either the ObjectID, or a unique combination of attribute-value pairs
The name of the object type to query
The name of primary key attribute to use to find the resource
The value of the primary key attribute to use to find the resource

A list of attribute names to retrieve from the resource. If the object type is known (using the -ObjectType parameter), then all attributes from the object type are returned, unless a subset of attributes are specified with this parameter. If the ObjectType parameter is not used, then only the ObjectID is returned, unless the specific attributes required are specified with this parameter
The ObjectID of the resource to get

A list of attribute names to retrieve from the resource. If the object type is known (using the -ObjectType parameter), then all attributes from the object type are returned, unless a subset of attributes are specified with this parameter. If the ObjectType parameter is not used, then only the ObjectID is returned, unless the specific attributes required are specified with this parameter
The name of the object type to query
A hashtable of attribute-value pairs that uniquely identify the object to get

A list of attribute names to retrieve from the resource. If the object type is known (using the -ObjectType parameter), then all attributes from the object type are returned, unless a subset of attributes are specified with this parameter. If the ObjectType parameter is not used, then only the ObjectID is returned, unless the specific attributes required are specified with this parameter
The name of the object type to query
The name of primary key attribute to use to find the resource
The value of the primary key attribute to use to find the resource

A list of attribute names to retrieve from the resource. If the object type is known (using the -ObjectType parameter), then all attributes from the object type are returned, unless a subset of attributes are specified with this parameter. If the ObjectType parameter is not used, then only the ObjectID is returned, unless the specific attributes required are specified with this parameter
The ObjectID of the resource to get
A hashtable of attribute-value pairs that uniquely identify the object to get

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet will throw a TooManyResults exception if more than one object is returned from an anchor attribute/value pair search. To return multiple objects, use the Search-Resources cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get a Person using its AccountName attribute --------------------------
-------------------------- Get a Person using a primary key attribute, returning selected attributes --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a Person using its AccountName attribute, and uses the AttributesToGet parameter to return only the JobTitle attribute

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get a Person using the AccountName and domain anchor pair --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a person resource using multiple attribute-value pairs that uniquely identify the resource

maml:description.maml:para: Counts the number of resources that match the specified search criteria
Returns a simple count of the number of resources in the FIM/MIM service that match the specified XPath search criteria
The XPath query to use to perform the search
The XPath query to use to perform the search
Imports a delcared configuration set into the FIM/MIM service
The Import-RMConfig cmdlet is used to import a configuration definition from an XML file
The path of the XML file containing the configuration to import
Optional. Indicates that the cmdlet should only report changes required, without committing them to the FIM service
The path of the XML file containing the configuration to import
Optional. Indicates that the cmdlet should only report changes required, without committing them to the FIM service

maml:alert.maml:para: See the 'configuration management' link for a full guide on using the XML file format

maml:description.maml:para: The New-Resource cmdlet creates a new object template for creation in the FIM/MIM service
This cmdlet creates an empty resource of the specified type, which can then later be saved with the Save-Resource cmdlet.
The system name of the object type in the schema to create
The system name of the object type in the schema to create

maml:alert.maml:para: The resource is not created in the FIM/MIM service itself, until the Save-Resource cmdlet is used

maml:description.maml:para: The New-XPathExpression cmdlet allows you to declaratively create an XPath expression
The cmdlet takes a query or group generated with the New-XPathQuery or New-XPathQueryGroup cmdlets and produces an XPath expression that can be used in the following manners

1. As an input to the Search-Resources cmdlet 2. As an input to the New-XPathQuery cmdlet 3. By using the ToString() method, you can generate an expression to use elsewhere in your script 4. When setting a resource attribute that expects a Filter type
The type of object to query. To search on all object types, use the value *
The query or group generated using the New-XPathQuery or New-XPathQueryGroup cmdlet
Specifies a reference-type attribute to query. See the example section for more information.
Specifies that the resulting XPath expression should be wrapped in the filter XML element used when setting the Filter attribute on sets and groups.
The type of object to query. To search on all object types, use the value *
The query or group generated using the New-XPathQuery or New-XPathQueryGroup cmdlet
Specifies a reference-type attribute to query. See the example section for more information.
Specifies that the resulting XPath expression should be wrapped in the filter XML element used when setting the Filter attribute on sets and groups.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Creating a basic expression --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Creates an expression that searches for users with the account name 'ryan' $query = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "ryan" $expression = New-XPathExpression -ObjectType "Person" -QueryObject $query $expression.ToString()

dev:remarks.maml:para: /Person[(AccountName = 'ryan')]

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Passing the expression to the Search-Resources cmdlet --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Creates an expression that searches for users with the account name 'ryan' $query = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "ryan" $expression = New-XPathExpression -ObjectType "Person" -QueryObject $query Search-Resources $expression

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Building an expression to dereference an object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Creates an expression that returns the manager of a user who has the account name 'ryan' $query = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "ryan" $expression = New-XPathExpression -ObjectType "Person" -QueryObject $query -DereferenceAttribute "Manager" $expression.ToString()

dev:remarks.maml:para: The expression builder supports dereferencing expressions, as supported by the Resource Management Service (See the FIM XPath filter dialect link). The following example finds the manager of a user with the account name 'ryan'
/Person[(AccountName = 'ryan')]/Manager

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Building a nested expression to find objects with dereferencing --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Build an expression to find a user by its account name $query = New-XpathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "ryan" $expression = New-XpathExpression -ObjectType "Person" -Query $query
# Build a query to find all users with a manager who has the account name 'ryan' $derefQuery = New-XpathQuery -AttributEName "Manager" -Operator Equals -Value $expression $derefExpression = New-XpathExpression Person $derefQuery $derefExpression.ToString()

dev:remarks.maml:para: /Person[(Manager = /Person[(AccountName = 'ryan')])]

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Building an expression to use in a group or set filter --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: <Filter xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" Dialect="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2006/11/XPathFilterDialect" xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/09/enumeration">/Person[(AccountName = 'ryan')]</Filter>

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new XPath query component

The New-XPathQuery cmdlet create a new query object that can be used to create an XPath expression using New-XPathExpression, or an element in an XPath query group using New-XPathQueryGroup. The resulting XPathExpression can be passed as a parameter to Search-Resources. An XPath query object contains the component of an expression that compares an attribute with a value.
The name of the attribute to compare
The operator to apply to the attribute

Optional if using the IsPresent or IsNotPresentOperator. Required for all other operators. The value to use in the comparison. This can be any value that can be converted to the data type of the attribute being searched. Reference attributes can also specify another XPath expression as the search value. See the dereferencing example.

Optional. Negates the expression by inverting the comparison operation. For example, using the Negate switch, the LessThan operator becomes not LessThan. Note that the FIM XPath dialect does not support double negation. Therefore using the Negate parameter on IsNotPresent and NotEquals operators is not supported.
The name of the attribute to compare
The operator to apply to the attribute

Optional if using the IsPresent or IsNotPresentOperator. Required for all other operators. The value to use in the comparison. This can be any value that can be converted to the data type of the attribute being searched. Reference attributes can also specify another XPath expression as the search value. See the dereferencing example.

Optional. Negates the expression by inverting the comparison operation. For example, using the Negate switch, the LessThan operator becomes not LessThan. Note that the FIM XPath dialect does not support double negation. Therefore using the Negate parameter on IsNotPresent and NotEquals operators is not supported.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The New-XPathQuery does not return a usable query itself. It returns only a part of the query that is used in an XPath expression. You can view the query component itself as shown in this example.
(AccountName = 'ryan')
In order to use the query, it must be rendered by an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet
/Person[(AccountName = 'ryan')]

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Building an expression using the pipeline --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: The IsPresent and IsNotPresent operators work without the Value parameter
/Person[(starts-with(AccountName, '%'))]

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Using a second XPath expression to query a reference attribute --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Build an expression to find a user by its account name $query = New-XpathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "ryan" $expression = New-XpathExpression -ObjectType "Person" -Query $query
# Build a query to find all users with a manager who has the account name 'ryan' $derefQuery = New-XpathQuery -AttributeName "Manager" -Operator Equals -Value $expression $derefExpression = New-XpathExpression Person $derefQuery $derefExpression.ToString()

dev:remarks.maml:para: /Person[(Manager = /Person[(AccountName = 'ryan')])]

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new XPath query group

The New-XPathQueryGroup cmdlet create a new group of query objects that can be used to create an XPath expression using New-XPathExpression, or an element in an XPath query group using New-XPathQueryGroup. The resulting XPathExpression can be passed as a parameter to Search-Resources. An XPath query group contains one or more XPath query objects or other XPathQueryGroup objects.
Specifies the logical operator to use when comparing queries within the group. The support values are And and Or
One or more query objects generated with the New-XPathQuery or New-XPathQueryGroup cmdlets
Specifies the logical operator to use when comparing queries within the group. The support values are And and Or
One or more query objects generated with the New-XPathQuery or New-XPathQueryGroup cmdlets

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Viewing the query group string --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $query1 = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "ryan" $query2 = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "bob" $queryGroup = New-XPathQueryGroup -Operator Or -Queries @($query1, $query2) $queryGroup .ToString()

dev:remarks.maml:para: The New-XPathQueryGroup does not return a usable query itself. It returns only a part of the query that is used in an XPath expression. You can view the query component itself as shown in this example.
((AccountName = 'ryan') or (AccountName = 'bob'))

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Building a simple query --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $query1 = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "ryan" $query2 = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "AccountName" -Operator Equals -Value "bob" $queryGroup = New-XPathQueryGroup -Operator Or -Queries ($query1, $query2) $expression = New-XPathExpression -ObjectType "Person" -QueryObject $queryGroup $expression.ToString()

dev:remarks.maml:para: In order to use the query, it must be rendered by an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet
/Person[((AccountName = 'ryan') or (AccountName = 'bob'))]

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Building a nested query --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $query1 = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "DisplayName" -Operator StartsWith -Value "ryan" $query2 = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "DisplayName" -Operator Equals -Value "bob" # Create the child group $queryGroup1 = New-XPathQueryGroup -Operator Or -Queries @($query1, $query2) $query3 = New-XPathQuery -AttributeName "Email" -Operator IsPresent # Create the parent group using the child group and another query $queryGroup2 = New-XPathQueryGroup -Operator And -Queries @($query3, $queryGroup1) $expression = New-XPathExpression -ObjectType "Person" -QueryObject $queryGroup2 $expression.ToString()

dev:remarks.maml:para: A query group can contain other groups as well as standard queries
/Person[((starts-with(Email, '%')) and ((starts-with(DisplayName, 'ryan')) or (DisplayName = 'bob')))]

maml:description.maml:para: The Remove-Resource cmdlet deletes one or more objects from the FIM Service

The ResourceObjects parameter can be used to pass in an array of resource objects to delete, which will be performed as a single composite request. Note, that if using the pipeline to perform the operation, PowerShell will pass the objects to the cmdlet one at a time, and a composite operation will not be performed.
One or more ResourceObjects returned from Get-Resource or Search-Resources to delete
One or more ResourceObjects returned from Get-Resource or Search-Resources to delete

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get a Person using its AccountName attribute, and delete it --------------------------
-------------------------- Delete all email templates as a composite operation --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Saves changes made to a resource or resources

The Save-Resource cmdlet processes pending changes on resource objects obtained from the New-Resource, Search-Resources, and Get-Resource cmdlets, and submits them to the FIM service. The Save-Resource cmdlet provides the ability to take objects from the pipeline and save them individually, as well as passing in an array of objects and processing them in a single composite operation.
One or more resources returned from New-Resource, Get-Resource or Search-Resources to save

Optional. When this switch is used, the client will perform an update to the resources on multiple threads. It is recommended to pass in an array to the -Resources parameter, which will trigger a composite update instead.
One or more resources returned from New-Resource, Get-Resource or Search-Resources to save

Optional. When this switch is used, the client will perform an update to the resources on multiple threads. It is recommended to pass in an array to the -Resources parameter, which will trigger a composite update instead.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the user with the account name 'testuser' and updates it's display name to "Test User2"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Save multiple objects in a single composite operation --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update the location attribute of multiple objects and save them as a single composite operation
Create a new resource template for the object type 'Person', populates some attributes, and saves the new resource

maml:description.maml:para: Searches for resources in the FIM/MIM service

The Search-Resources cmdlet allows you to perform a query for multiple objects from the FIM Service. By default, the cmdlet returns only the ObjectType, ObjectID, and DisplayName attributes for the objects matched by the query string. Use the ExpectedObjectClass or AttributesToGet parameters to control the attributes that are returned.
The query to use in the search operation. This can be a string or an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet
Optional. Specifies the expected object type that will be returned from the query. The client will use this to return all the attributes from that type in the schema
Optional. Limits the number of results returned by the search operation.
Optional. Specifies how many results should be retrieved per page.
Specifies a list of attribute names used to order the results
Specifies that the sort attributes should be sorted in descending order (default is ascending)
The query to use in the search operation. This can be a string or an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet
A list of attributes to retrieve for the objects matching the search criteria
Optional. Limits the number of results returned by the search operation.
Optional. Specifies how many results should be retrieved per page.
Specifies a list of attribute names used to order the results
Specifies that the sort attributes should be sorted in descending order (default is ascending)
The query to use in the search operation. This can be a string or an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet

Optional. Performs an unconstrained query, allowing the FIM service to process all attributes in the schema when a matched object is found. This option should be used with caution as it causes significant performance impact on the FIM service.
Optional. Limits the number of results returned by the search operation.
Optional. Specifies how many results should be retrieved per page.
Specifies a list of attribute names used to order the results
Specifies that the sort attributes should be sorted in descending order (default is ascending)
The query to use in the search operation. This can be a string or an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet
Optional. Specifies the expected object type that will be returned from the query. The client will use this to return all the attributes from that type in the schema
Optional. Limits the number of results returned by the search operation.
Optional. Specifies how many results should be retrieved per page.
Specifies a list of attribute names used to order the results
Specifies that the sort attributes should be sorted in descending order (default is ascending)
A list of attributes to retrieve for the objects matching the search criteria

Optional. Performs an unconstrained query, allowing the FIM service to process all attributes in the schema when a matched object is found. This option should be used with caution as it causes significant performance impact on the FIM service.

maml:alert.maml:para: Use the AttributesToGet parameter to specify the exact attributes you want to return. The cmdlet will only return ObjectType and ObjectID unless specific attributes are specified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get all sets with only mandatory attributes --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will retrieve all sets, but as neither the AttributesToGet or ExpectedObjectType parameters have been specified, only the ObjectID and ObjectType attributes will be returned

This command gets all workflow definition objects. As the object type returned from the query is known, the command will return all attributes in the schema for the WorkflowDefinition type as part of the result set

dev:remarks.maml:para: The example above uses the New-XPathQuery cmdlet to define a search criteria without having to write the XPath by hand

maml:description.maml:para: Performs a paged search for resources in the FIM/MIM service

The Search-ResourcesPaged cmdlet allows you to perform a query for multiple objects from the FIM Service, with advanced controls of how you navigate through the result set. For standard searching, see the Search-Resources cmdlet.
The query to use in the search operation. This can be a string or an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet
Optional. Specifies the expected object type that will be returned from the query. The client will use this to request the attributes from that class as part of the query.
Optional. Specifies how many results should be retrieved per page.
Optional. Specifies a list of attribute names used to order the results
Optional. Specifies that the sort attributes should be sorted in descending order (default is ascending)
The query to use in the search operation. This can be a string or an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet
Optional. A list of attributes to retrieve for the objects matching the search criteria
Optional. Specifies how many results should be retrieved per page.
Optional. Specifies a list of attribute names used to order the results
Optional. Specifies that the sort attributes should be sorted in descending order (default is ascending)
The query to use in the search operation. This can be a string or an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet

Optional. Performs an unconstrained query, allowing the FIM service to process all attributes in the schema when a matched object is found. This option should be used with caution as it causes significant performance impact on the FIM service.
Optional. Specifies how many results should be retrieved per page.
Optional. Specifies a list of attribute names used to order the results
Optional. Specifies that the sort attributes should be sorted in descending order (default is ascending)
The query to use in the search operation. This can be a string or an XPath expression created with the New-XPathExpression cmdlet
Optional. Specifies the expected object type that will be returned from the query. The client will use this to request the attributes from that class as part of the query.
Optional. Specifies how many results should be retrieved per page.
Optional. Specifies a list of attribute names used to order the results
Optional. Specifies that the sort attributes should be sorted in descending order (default is ascending)
Optional. A list of attributes to retrieve for the objects matching the search criteria

Optional. Performs an unconstrained query, allowing the FIM service to process all attributes in the schema when a matched object is found. This option should be used with caution as it causes significant performance impact on the FIM service.

maml:alert.maml:para: By default, the cmdlet returns only the ObjectType, ObjectID, and DisplayName attributes for the objects matched by the query string. Use the ExpectedObjectClass or AttributesToGet parameters to control the attributes that are returned.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets parameters for connecting to the FIM/MIM service
The Set-ResourceManagementClient cmdlet allows you to control parameters of the connection to the FIM Service.

Optional. Specifies the URL to the resource management web service. If not specified, the default value of http://localhost:5725 is used. The http prefix and port can be ommitted, and the just hostname provided
Optional. By default, the credentials of the currently logged on user are used. Other credentials can be specified using this parameter
Optional. By default the client will use FIMService/hostname for the SPN. You can override the SPN used here
Optional. A value indicating if the client should force Kerberos, and not allow NTLM authentication to the FIM service

Optional. Specifies the URL to the resource management web service. If not specified, the default value of http://localhost:5725 is used. The http prefix and port can be ommitted, and the just hostname provided
Optional. By default, the credentials of the currently logged on user are used. Other credentials can be specified using this parameter
Optional. By default the client will use FIMService/hostname for the SPN. You can override the SPN used here
Optional. A value indicating if the client should force Kerberos, and not allow NTLM authentication to the FIM service

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Connect to the FIM service with a specific URL --------------------------
-------------------------- Connect to the FIM service using only a hostname --------------------------
-------------------------- Connect to the FIM service with a specific address and SPN --------------------------
-------------------------- Allow the client to fall back to NTLM authentication --------------------------
-------------------------- Connect to the FIM service with specific credentials --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Refreshes the cached copy of the FIM/MIM service schema

The Update-ResourceManagementClientSchema cmdlet refreshes the client's copy of the schema from the Resource Management service. This cmdlet should be called after making changes to resource type, attribute, and binding objects
